Mapcolonies : Catalog Authentication Usage Examples

Created by shimonc1, last modified by Tal Zmiri on Mar 09, 2022

The following section will help you understand how to make authenticated requests to our Catalog.

Below examples will include “http://localhost:8080” as host url

Do not forget to change the url to our real host url

When making any request to our Catalog, the x-api-key header should be supplied. If no token is supplied then the request will get a 403 http response code.

Example for GetCapabilities request:

curl --location --request GET 'http://localhost:8080/csw?request=GetCapabilities&service=CSW' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/xml' \
--header 'cache-control: no-cache' \
--header 'origin: stam' \
--header 'x-api-key: <token>' \
--data-raw '<csw:GetRecords xmlns="http://www.opengis.net/cat/csw/2.0.2"
    xmlns:csw="http://www.opengis.net/cat/csw/2.0.2"
    xmlns:ogc="http://www.opengis.net/ogc"
    xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"
    xmlns:ows="http://www.opengis.net/ows"
    xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"
    xmlns:dct="http://purl.org/dc/terms/"
    xmlns:mc="http://schema.mapcolonies.com"
    xmlns:gmd="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmd"
    xmlns:gco="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gco" service="CSW" version="2.0.2" request="GetRecords" typenames="[SUB-SYSTEM-TYPENAME]" ElementSetName="full" resultType="results" outputSchema="http://schema.mapcolonies.com/raster">
</csw:GetRecords>'
